critique: This document is an executive order from 1933 related to the National Industrial Recovery Act and the Men's Clothing Industry. It focuses on amendments to the Code of Fair Competition, including provisions for learners, posting of the code, top coat definitions, and employment of individuals with disabilities. It seems to be an example of government intervention in the economy during the New Deal era. It does not seem to touch on immigration, civil liberties, or federalism in any significant way. The document seems to promote social inclusion by providing guidelines for employing individuals with disabilities. The document expands executive power by modifying a previous executive order.
